User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments – some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player. 

AI:**Enumerations:**
1. PlayerPosition (e.g. GK, LB, etc.)
2. PlayerAttribute (name and value pair)

**Classes:**
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
2. Employee
3. HeadCoach
4. Director
5. Scout
6. Player
7. ScoutingAssignment
8. ScoutingReport
9. ShortList
10. Offer

**Attributes:**
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
   - employees: List<Employee>
   - shortList: ShortList

2. Employee
   - name: String
   - role: String

3. HeadCoach
   - designatedPlayerProfiles: List<Player>
   - designatedTargetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>

4. Director
   - officialOffers: List<Offer>

5. Scout
   - scoutingList: List<Player>
   - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>

6. Player
   - name: String
   - position: PlayerPosition
   - attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>

7. ScoutingAssignment
   - scout: Scout
   - player: Player

8. ScoutingReport
   - player: Player
   - pros: List<String>
   - cons: List<String>
   - recommendation: String

9. ShortList
   - players: List<Player>

10. Offer
    - player: Player
    - amount: Double

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:**Enumerations:**
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, etc.): Represents the designated target positions for a player.
2. PlayerAttribute (name, value): Represents the attributes of a player identified by a name and a value.

**Classes:**
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: List<Employee>, shortList: ShortList): Represents the system used by the club for scouting players.
2. Employee(name: String, role: String): Represents an employee of the club.
3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<Player>, designatedTargetPositions: List<PlayerPosition): Represents the head coach of the club.
4. Director(officialOffers: List<Offer>): Represents the director of the club.
5. Scout(scoutingList: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment): Represents a scout.
6. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player.
7. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player): Represents a scouting assignment.
8. ScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: List<String>, cons: List<String>, recommendation: String): Represents a scouting report.
9. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a shortlist of players.
10. Offer(player: Player, amount: Double): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments – some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player. 

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - etc.

2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Role (e.g. head coach, director, scout)

2. Player
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Position (PlayerPosition)
     - Other Attributes (List of name-value pairs)

3. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)

4. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - AssignedTo (Employee)

5. ShortListedPlayer
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - ScoutingRounds (List of ScoutingReports)

6. OfficialOffer
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - OfferedBy (Employee)

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, etc.): Represents the designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, etc.): Indicates the recommendation status for a player in the scouting report.

### Classes:
1. Employee (Name: string, Role: string): Represents an employee of the club with their name and role within the scouting system.
2. Player (Name: string, Position: PlayerPosition, OtherAttributes: List<NameValue>): Represents a player with their name, position, and other attributes recorded during scouting.
3. ScoutingReport (Player: Player, Pros: string, Cons: string, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report for a player with pros, cons, and recommendation.
4. ScoutingAssignment (Player: Player, AssignedTo: Employee): Represents a scouting assignment linking a player to the assigned employee.
5. ShortListedPlayer (Player: Player, ScoutingRounds: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents a player on the shortlist with multiple scouting rounds and reports.
6. OfficialOffer (Player: Player, OfferedBy: Employee): Represents an official offer made by an employee for a player.

2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player

   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. Club
   - Attributes: 
     - employees (list of Employee)

2. Employee
   - Attributes: 
     - role

3. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:

    - Attributes:

    - Attributes:

      - results (list of ScoutingResult)

12. ScoutingResult
    - Attributes:

- PlayerAttribute
  - name
  - value

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, etc.): Represents the designated target positions for a player.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, etc.): Represents the recommendations for player signings.

Classes:
1. Club(employees: list of Employee): Represents the club entity with a list of employees.
2. Employee(role: String): Represents an employee with a specific role.
3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: list of PlayerProfile): Represents the head coach with designated player profiles.
4. Director(scoutingAssignments: list of ScoutingAssignment): Represents the director with scouting assignments.
5. Scout(longList: list of Player, scoutingReports: list of ScoutingReport): Represents a scout with a long list of players and scouting reports.
6. HeadScout(scoutingAssignments: list of ScoutingAssignment): Represents the head scout with scouting assignments.
7. Player(name: String, attributes: list of PlayerAttribute, scoutingResults: list of ScoutingResult): Represents a player with attributes and scouting results.
8. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: list of PlayerPosition): Represents a player profile with target positions.
9. ScoutingAssignment(player: Player, scoutingRounds: list of ScoutingRound): Represents a scouting assignment for a player.
10. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and recommendation.
11. ScoutingRound(scout: Scout, results: list of ScoutingResult): Represents a scouting round with a scout and results.
12. ScoutingResult(player: Player, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting result for a player.
13. OfficialOffer(player: Player): Represents an official offer for a player.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. AI:## Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK
   - LB
   - CB
   - RB
   - CDM
   - CM
   - LM
   - RM
   - LW
   - RW
   - ST

2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

## Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - Role

2. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:
     - DesignatedPlayerProfiles

3. Director
   - Attributes:
     - OfficialOffers

4. Scout
   - Attributes:
     - LongList
     - ScoutingReports

5. Player
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - PlayerAttributes

6. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - Scout
     - Player
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation

7. ScoutingRound
   - Attributes:
     - ShortListedPlayers

8. OfficialOffer
   - Attributes:
     - Player

## Attributes:
1. DesignatedPlayerProfiles
   - List of designated player profiles identified by the head coach

2. OfficialOffers
   - List of official offers made by the director for players

3. LongList
   - List of players noted by scouts that match a designated target profile

4. ScoutingReports
   - List of scouting reports submitted by scouts for players

5. PlayerAttributes
   - List of player attributes identified by name and value

6. Pros
   - Positive aspects of a player noted in a scouting report

7. Cons
   - Negative aspects of a player noted in a scouting report

8. Recommendation
   - Recommendation for a player in a scouting report

9. ShortListedPlayers
   - List of players moved to the short list after comparing scouting results

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, CB, RB, CDM, CM, LM, RM, LW, RW, ST): Represents the different positions a player can play in a team.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing): Represents the recommendations for a player based on scouting reports.

Classes:
1. Employee(Role: String): Represents an employee in the club with a specific role.
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(OfficialOffers: List<OfficialOffer>): Represents the director who makes official offers for players.
4. Scout(LongList: List<Player>, ScoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents a scout who notes players in a long list and submits scouting reports.
5. Player(Name: String, PlayerAttributes: List<String, String>): Represents a player with a name and attributes.
6. ScoutingAssignment(Scout: Scout, Player: Player, Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting assignment with details and recommendations.
7. ScoutingRound(ShortListedPlayers: List<Player>): Represents a round of scouting with short-listed players.
8. OfficialOffer(Player: Player): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, etc.): Represents designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, etc.): Represents the recommendations for player signings in the scouting system.

### Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: List<Employee>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>, shortListedPlayers: List<Player>): Represents the main system used by the club for scouting players.
2. Employee(id: int, name: String, role: String): Represents an employee of the club involved in the scouting system.
3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach of the club responsible for identifying player profiles.
4. Director: Represents the director of the club involved in the player signing process.
5. Scout(scoutingList: List<Player>, scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents a scout in the scouting system.
6. Player(name: String, attributes: Map<String, String>, position: PlayerPosition, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a player in the scouting system with attributes, position, and recommendation.
7. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player): Represents an assignment given to a scout to evaluate a player.
8. ScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a report submitted by a scout about a player.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments – some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

1. **PlayerPosition** (GK, LB, CB, RB, CM, LM, RM, ST, etc.)
2. **PlayerRecommendation** (KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ReserveTeamPlayer, ProspectivePlayer, NotAGoodSigning)

    - Attributes: 
      - player: Player
      - amount: double

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, CB, RB, CM, LM, RM, ST, etc.): Represents different positions that a player can play, facilitating the identification of target positions for player profiles.
2. PlayerRecommendation(KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ReserveTeamPlayer, ProspectivePlayer, NotAGoodSigning): Provides recommendations on the suitability of a player for signing based on scouting reports.

### Classes:
1. Employee(id: int, name: string, role: string): Represents a general employee with basic information such as ID, name, and role within the club.
2. HeadCoach(coachingLicense: string): Represents the head coach of the club with a coaching license for managing player profiles and scouting assignments.
3. Director(budget: double): Represents the director of the club with a budget to make official offers for players recommended for signing.
4. Scout(expertise: string): Represents a scout with expertise in evaluating players and submitting scouting reports.
5. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, otherAttributes: Map<string, string>): Represents the profile of a player with target positions and additional attributes.
6. Player(name: string, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: Map<string, string>): Represents a player with a name, position, and additional attributes.
7. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment linking a scout, player, and scouting report.
8. ScoutingReport(pros: string, cons: string, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report detailing the strengths, weaknesses, and recommendation for a player.
9. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a list of players shortlisted for further evaluation by the head coach and head scout.
10. OfficialOffer(player: Player, amount: double): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player recommended for signing.
